 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פַּרְשֶׁ֫גֶן‎</span> **noun masculine**<sup>[[Ezra.4.23|Ezra 4:23]]</sup> ==copy== ([[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎שַׁנְנָא‎</span>-, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; Aramaic loan-word in Biblical Hebrew, where also <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פַּתְשֶׁנֶן‎</span> ***id.***; loan-word from Persian ([[BDB#Thes|Thes]]<sup>1133</sup>; Add.108), compare Armenian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***pat³ên***</u></abbr>, ***copy***, Gildemeister<sup>ZKM iv. 210</sup> [[BDB#Lag|Lag]]<sup>Ges. Abh. 79, Armen. Stud. § 1838</sup> [[BDB#Mey|Mey]]<sup>Enst. J. 22</sup> [[BDB#Hoffm|HoffmZA ii. 52]], Old Iranian \* <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***paticayan***</u></abbr>, ***id.***, according to [[BDB#Andr|Andr]]<sup>M 79</sup>\*; not clear whether <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פַּר‎</span> is textual error for <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פּת‎</span> ([[BDB#Hoffm|Hoffm]]<sup> 1.c</sup>.), or from different original ([[BDB#Andr|Andr]]<sup>l.c.</sup> <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***para™ayan***</u></abbr>? <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***paricayan***</u></abbr>?), or from same √ in different stage (so apparently [[BDB#Scheft|Scheft]]<sup>52, citing, for both</sup>, Old Baktrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***fra-s®nhana***</u></abbr>, ***announcement***, Old Iranian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***pra´amsana, pra´¹sana***</u></abbr>, ***command***, Arabic <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***frasasti***</u></abbr>, ***command***, <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***patisênhana***</u></abbr>, ***answer***, Old Persian \*<abbr title="transliteration"><u>***patithanhana***</u></abbr>, ***announcement, answer***)); — construct <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎פ‎</span> [[Ezra.4.11|Ezra 4:11]]; [[Ezra.4.23|Ezra 4:23]]; [[Ezra.5.6|Ezra 5:6]].
